bibl.title: Qui Miscuit Utile Dulci. Festschrift Essays for Paul Lachlan MacKendrick
bibl.note: On the interpretation of the words ascribed to the dying Caesar (SUETONIUS 82, 3; CASSIUS DIO 44, 19, 5) in light of a stele in Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum (#E.49.1901), which contains the words καὶ σύ. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 71 (2002) No. 5199.
bibl.seg: BRENK Frederick E., Caesar and the Evil Eye or What to do with καὶ σύ, τέκνον.
Gareth L. SCHMELING and Jon D. MIKALSON (Edd.), Qui Miscuit Utile Dulci. Festschrift Essays for Paul Lachlan MacKendrick (Wauconda, 1998) pp. 31-49.

On the interpretation of the words ascribed to the dying Caesar (SUETONIUS 82, 3; CASSIUS DIO 44, 19, 5) in light of a stele in Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum (#E.49.1901), which contains the words καὶ σύ. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 71 (2002) No. 5199.
